thread.title: India A trail by 133 runs in warm-up game against Bangladesh
thread.title_full: India A trail by 133 runs in warm-up game against Bangladesh

title: India A trail by 133 runs in warm-up game against Bangladesh
text:
India A trail by 133 runs in warm-up game against Bangladesh >> IANS/bdnews24.com Previous Next India A have posted 91/1, trailing by 133 runs against Bangladesh in the two-day warm-up game at the Gymkhana Ground in Hyderabad. 
Priyank Panchal (40) and Shreyas Iyre (29) were at the crease when umpires removed the bails for the day on Sunday. 
For Bangladesh, Subashis Roy took the Indian opener Abhinav Mukund, who scored 16 runs in 31 balls. 
Opting to bat first, Bangladesh declared their innings at 224/8 with Mushfiqur Rahim (58) and Soumya Sarkar (52) playing the crucial roles. 
Middle-order batsman Sabbir Rahman also contributed with 33 runs in 68 balls. 
For the hosts, Aniket Choudhary scalped four wickets for 26 runs while Chama Milind, Vijay Shankar Shahbaz Nadeem and Kuldeep Yadav chipped in with one wicket each. 
Brief scores: Bangladesh 224/8 ( Mushfiqur Rahim 58 and Soumya Sarkar 52; Aniket Choudhary 4-26) against India A (Priyank Panchal 40 and Shreyas Iyre 29; Subashis Roy 1-11) on Day One.
